body:
> but it should probably implicitly propagate `@psalm-immutable` to `MutableImplementation`

Probably it should be limited to methods covered by `SomethingImmutable` only.

@weirdan interesting view on it. Can you elaborate on a scenario where two interfaces are involved, and mutability would be an advantage? I'd expect any state touched by `SomethingImmutable` implementations (even if just the methods) to require immutability/read-only.
I think Java's `StringBuilder` which implements read-only `CharacterSequence` interface could be a good example (in a single-threaded environment, as long as you don't hold references to it).
Heya, have you seen the example above? Passing around something expected to be immutable (while it is not) is seriously problematic
But on the other hand if it was just enforced at the method level I _think_ it'd be OK, too.

> Passing around something expected to be immutable (while it is not) is seriously problematic

Why do you think so? I assume it's because something outside of `MyBankAccount` could mutate the `MyMoney` instance?

```php
$myMoney = new MyMoney();
$myBankAccount = new MyBankAccount($myMoney);
$myMoney->increment(); // $myBankAccount has implicitely changed
```

That's a valid point. This is a hard issue to solve with reference types. Swift for example only tracks mutability for structs which are value types. Although `@immutable` doesn't mean pure so Psalm shouldn't assume that `gimme()` always returns the same value either way.

Misconception probably comes from how this was documented: `@immutable` in psalm is "all method are `@pure`", but then I'd propose:

 * `@immutable` at class/interface means immutable and pure (also subtypes)
 * `@pure` at class/interface means that the API of that class (and any subtype) is `@pure`

That would probably be less confusing.

Further on, having this pseudo-immutability means that any less experienced developer can subclass an immutable type and add mutators (seen it happen many times), therefore breaking simple invariants of running systems. This is neither good nore helpful ðŸ˜…
